title: Cranberry-Apple Tuna Salad
summary: Cranberry-Apple Tuna Salad is a dairy free and pescatarian main course. For $1.87 per serving, this recipe covers 21% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 1 servings with 491 calories, 30g of protein, and 11g of fat each. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 10 minutes. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. Head to the store and pick up apple, pita pocket, cranberries, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the dried cranberries you could follow this main course with the Breakfast Cookies as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 68%. This score is good. Similar recipes are Cranberry Apple Tuna Salad, Cranberry Tuna Salad, and Cranberry Tuna Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Raymond R Collection Merlot with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Raymond R Collection Merlot
productMatches.description: The Merlot fills the mouth with smooth cherry, raspberry and plum flavors along with hints of earth and spice in the toasty vanilla finish. Full-bodied, yet approachable, with a good balance of acid and tannins. Pair with anything from grilled salmon, pork tenderloin, barbequed chicken and ribs to Thai red curry or Moroccan tagine.

instructions: In a small bowl, combine the tuna, cranberries, apple, and mayonnaise. Cut the pita in half. Fill each half with the tuna salad and sprouts.

steps.step: In a small bowl, combine the tuna, cranberries, apple, and mayonnaise.
Cut the pita in half. Fill each half with the tuna salad and sprouts.
